body_html:
@pkuwjf Master version pytorch + latest cuda/cudnn work fine.
Also, if I remembering correctly, on 0.2.0_3 you can disable cudnn via torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False for second order grad with convolution to work, but it'll be quite slow.
body_text:
@pkuwjf Master version pytorch + latest cuda/cudnn work fine.
Also, if I remembering correctly, on 0.2.0_3 you can disable cudnn via torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False for second order grad with convolution to work, but it'll be quite slow.
body:
@pkuwjf Master version pytorch + latest cuda/cudnn work fine.
Also, if I remembering correctly, on 0.2.0_3 you can disable cudnn via `torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False` for second order grad with convolution to work, but it'll be quite slow.
